" I went on-line on Saturday 14th December 24 to request the deal for the Apple iPhone 13 128 GB which was due to end at midnight on the 19th December. The girl I dealt with appeared very efficient and processed my order sending through my contract to my email address which I needed to sign within 72 hrs. When I went to sign the contract the following day that was when my nightmare started ! My husband noticed they had put the wrong address on the contract and my sort code was also incorrect. When I made contact with the team the following day they said they could amend the incorrect details but when I requested the new contract they said they could n't amend the contract as they would need to cancel the order and start again. I was not happy to sign a contract on-line which was incorrect and after a long time trying to explain this said they would have to cancel the contract and start again. I was advised to ring back the following day giving it time to cancel on the system. When I rang on the 17th December 2024 I initially spoke with someone who insisted I would have to accept the old contract which had n't been cancelled to get the deal despite me explaining that it had the wrong address and sort code. This gentleman put the phone down on me. With trepidation I phoned Vodafone back again on the 17th December once I went into my local Bishops Stortford store for some moral support at 3.20pm. I spoke to a gentleman on-line a Vodafone Customer Service called Stephan who was extremely rude and talked over me and after nearly two hours we were no further on with the process with him insisting the old contract was still online. The staff in store were extremely kind and supportive to me particularly Ben and his trainee , Ali , but unfortunately they could do nothing as the contract was still open on-line. Stephan advised to ring at 8am on the 18th December and he would cancel my original order. When I rang again today at 8am I spoke to Corrie who was polite and helpful but when he re-did the order again unfortunately when he got to the end of the process , it still would n't go through despite saying my order had been cancelled at 02.20am on the 18th. I was advised to ring again on the 19th which was the following day , noting that this deal ended at midnight on the 19th.I took the risk of ringing again today at 5.20pm and spoke to a very pleasant , empathetic young girl called Imaan , who was based in Lancaster. She reassured me that she would do her best to solve my problem and asked relevant questions which give me hope. At two different stages she checked with someone senior that the correct process was being followed and double checked my details with me to ensure everything was correct. She apologised for the distress I had encountered over the last four days with Vodafone and was genuinely caring towards me. Imaan managed to successfully process my order for the Apple iPhone and hopefully it will be delivered tomorrow. Her service was faultless. However the last four days has been an extremely distressing and stressful experience with the online service with Vodafone with each phone call at times taking up nearly two hours of my time. I praise Ben and Ali in the Bishops Stortford store and Lovely Imaan today but as for the other staff unfortunately I rate the overall service as poor.Where do we go from here , I would expect more than a written online apology for the time and stress this has caused me. I am sure Vodafone can do their homework and work out by the details I have provided who this service user is ! ! ! ! ! "

" We had T-Mobile internet service for 19 months. The T-Mobile service at the beginning was pretty good , with the service freezing needing a restart only about once a week. However , the towards the end in August of 2023 , the gateway ( modem ) needed to be restarted several times a day in order to function. Around the same time T-Mobile removed the $ 5 discount for auto pay if you were using a credit card. Something they had allowed for over a year. On Aug 23rd we ordered Xfinity. The Xfinity gateway would be delivered in several days. On Aug 24th , 2023 I called customer service and told them I wished to cancel. However , customer service said I needed to try a new gateway first to see if that would correct the problem. I figured I would compare them both. T-Mobile sent a replacement quickly , but it did not do much better with Mbps download of 44. The Xfinity gateway came a few days later with Mbps in the 400 's for downloads without any problems. I canceled T-Mobile service on Sept 2 , 23 through their customer service. When canceling they requested the 6 digit number that I gave them when I signed up 19 months earlier. I gave them the number I had written down in my T-Mobile file. The customer service rep said it was the wrong number. I said that is the one I uses. They said it was imperative that I give them the 6-digit code. I asked if they could use my soc sec number or email me a reset and they said no. They said that I would have to physically go to a T-Mobile store and request my 6-digit number after they verified my identity. I drove to the nearest store located at 2024 IL-50 Ste A1 , Bourbonnais IL 60914 and spoke with a rep named Michael. He said he could not give me the 6-digit number and told me to call customer service back and tell them so. I went home and called and told them what he said , and they said okay and that they would email a return label for the gateway. I received the email with the label on September 2nd , 2023 and returned the gateway to UPS. T-Mobile received the gateway on Sept 11 23. I received a letter stating that " " They received the gateway , and no further action is needed on your part. " " Then on Sept 19 , 23 T-Mobile collected an auto pay of $ 55 from my credit card on file. I called my credit card to dispute the charge. T-Mobile sent me a new bill asking for the $ 55 , plus $ 25 for a chargeback , Plus the next months $ 55 for a total of $ 135. I called customer service on Oct 7 , 23 , and they said I needed to go to an actual store because they could not help me again because of the 6-digit pin saying the one I gave them was incorrect. I went to the store in Bradley Il and they told me that the account had never been canceled , even though customer service sent the return label and had received the gateway. The store contacted T-mobile customer service from their store and eventually a very rude corporate manager named Patrick said that they insisted I pay the full $ 135. I explained I had cancelled the service on Sept 2 , 23 and returned the gateway. He said it was T-Mobiles ' policy to have you also physically come to the store to cancel and that it was n't officially canceled until that day which was over a month later. I told him I physically went to the T-Mobile store but Michael would not give me the pin. He scolded me saying I should have used the phrase " " I wish to have you cancel my account " " I explained that I had already done that with customer service rep on the phone and that I had told Michael that I needed the pin number for them to cancel it. Patrick from Corporate says that I am repeating myself and it was my fault for not saying that I wanted Michael to cancel the account. He then said that he would offer me a one-time deal that he would forgive the last months charge and that he was being very gracious in doing so. I again told him I did n't even have a gateway to use the service and that T-Mobile had it after sending me the return email and label. He again said it was never fully canceled to their satisfaction whatever that means. We went round and round until I said I would pay $ 55 for the month I disputed even though I had canceled the service just to end the madness. He said he also insisted on the $ 25. I said no and that I wanted to only pay $ 55 only on that day. He said it would cost an additional $ 10 to have an operator take my payment. I asked if I could do it online without a charge and he said yes but it would not give me a confirmation. Because he was not helpful at all we ended the call. I went home and paid $ 55 online and still received a confirmation number. It seemed that Patrick was trying to squeeze even more money from me. The amount of time and effort I have put into resolving this is ridicules. There appears to be no training for customer service either at the store level or at corporate.Update 10 / 15 / 23 T-Mobile reached out and we reached a mutual understanding . "

" I am writing to formally raise a complaint about the exceptionally poor service I have received , particularly from the Milton Keynes branch , as a loyal Vodafone customer of 10 years. Even after explaining this , the staff at the MK branch offered no apology or assistance , and I was sent away without a resolution.The following week , I had no choice but to bring my father into the store in a wheelchair to update the account and receive a new SIM card , which should have been done in the first place. This issue was somewhat resolved for a short period , but in December 2024 , my service dropped once again , this time for a more extended period.On December 28 , 2024 , my service dropped again and did not return. I was assured by both Sunny and another store manager that I would not incur any charges for repairs , and it was suggested that I return in the new year to send off the phone for repairs , as this would be quicker.I returned on January 7 , 2025 , to send the phone off for repair. " " After some assistance from the store manager , I was informed that my warranty had expired just a week prior to my visit. However , the interaction felt rushed and dismissive , especially as the store was nearing closing time.On January 17 , 2025 , I received my phone back in the mail , still broken , along with a letter stating that the repair could not be completed due to the warranty expiry. The letter also mentioned that they had attempted to contact me , but I have not received any emails or messages regarding this matter. This is entirely unacceptable. I am now left without a working phone and still being billed for the service.I am deeply dissatisfied with the entire process , the lack of communication , and the ongoing inconvenience this has caused. I have invested a significant amount of time visiting the store , engaging in live chats , and speaking on the phone , only to be left with no resolution and no confidence in the repair process. I was assured multiple times that this issue would be resolved , but I am now at square one , with no solution in sight.As part of the resolution to this matter , I would appreciate a full refund for the two-week period in August 2024 when I had no access to my phone , as was initially promised. Should this issue be resolved , please be assured that I will be discontinuing my relationship with Vodafone after 10 years of service.I look forward to your prompt response.Sincerely , Chloe MayockAnthony Mayock "
